result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M. Kuhtz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Deputy Corey Dassow.  This letter has been done and was approved.  Defendant shall undergo psychiatric treatment at the discretion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M. Kuhtz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Chad M. Kuhtz in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put on the record.  Victim rights have been complied.  Plea of no contest to count 3  - resisting/obstructing an officer.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 3. No statement by victim.   Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge; letter of apology to Deputy Corey Dassow which has already been done and approved; AODA and treatment; psychiatric treatment at the discretion of the probation agent; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent. Sentence credit one day.   Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed and read in.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant must take medications as prescribed.

Defendant Chad M. Kuhtz in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.    Plea of not guilty to all charges.   Defendant requests that the no contact conditions be lifted on the bond.  Court orders that no contact be taken off the bond but add to the bond that the defendant must take his medications as prescribed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.  - rt

Defendant Chad M. Kuhtz in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with A.C.K. - dob:  7-19-77.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with A.C.K. - dob:  7-19-77.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is April 7, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall haven no contact with A.C.K. - dob: 7-19-77.
